editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: ORIGEN, HOMILIES ON O. T. BOOKS; S. XIV, XIII in.

msItem.p: fol. i blank but for a few pen-trials. On the verso is a long table of contents to II, s. xiv, in the same hand as those in MSS 85, 180, 188, 277 and 314, perhaps John Reynham’s.

physDesc.p: A single book, the first quire supplied to complete art. 1. Strangely, this did not replace a quire once present but lost, for the present quire 2 is numbered 1.

supportDesc.extent: 174 leaves (i + 173) 335 225 the edges retrimmed with loss of marginalia and stained yellow
supportDesc.collation: 112(+ 1 after 12) / 1–208, 218(8 canc.); a singleton hooked around the first and last quires; the quires of I with catchwords, those of II numbered at the end.

binding.p: s. xv, heavily restored by Maltby: wide-bevelled oak boards with slightly projecting squares, now bared and rebacked with modern vellum; sewn on four bands. Formerly two straps from shallow recesses in the front board to catches at the rear. fol. 1 was once pasted down in a binding with much iron furniture, possibly including corner-bosses and a chain-staple in the middle of the foot. Near the foot of the rear board are the marks of the large brass chain-staple. There is no corresponding mark on fol. 173v.

history.provenance: At the head of fol. 14, s. xv, ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton in Oxon’ ex legato Magistri Ioh’ Raynham sacre pagine professoris et quondam socii eiusdem domus cuius anime propicietur Deus Amen.’ For Reynham, see MS 18.

At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘253’ (recte 255), s. xvii in. ‘3’ is inked on the foredge. On fol. i is a sheet of paper with contents, s. xvii, and ‘N. 3. 3. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘A. 3. 3 (XXIX)’ in red.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 21–2; Powicke, no. 346; Alexander & Temple, no. 159.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Joshua
msItem.rubric: Incipit prohemium exposicionis Origenis in Ihesu Naue
msItem.incipit: In diuinis uoluminibus refertur quid ad constructionem tabernaculi
msItem.explicit: (Hom. 8) merito coronari a Christo Domino nostro cui ...
msItem.note: At the head of fol. 1 is an inscription mostly cropped by the binder: ‘[ ... querit Origenes quorum una uocata ] / Augustinus de heresibus c. 4.’ CPG 1420; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 29 (1920), pp. 286–463; SChr 71 (1960).

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 240 150 , ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 43 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red highlighting.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Joshua
msItem.note: transl. Rufinus, continued from part I.
msItem.incipit: Postea quam subuertit Ihesu Gai id est chaos
msItem.explicit: ubi est uerus Israel in C. I. d. n. cui ...

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Judges
msItem.incipit: De eo quod scriptum est in libro Iudicum
Lector quidam presentis lectionis ita legebat
msItem.explicit: ut ab ipso uictoriam consequi mereamur in C. I. d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1421; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 30 (1920), pp. 464–522.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homily on I Sam. (‘De Helkanah et Fenenna et Anna’)
msItem.rubric: De Helchana et Fenenna et Anna
msItem.incipit: Non tunc tantummodo Deus plantauit paradisum
msItem.explicit: ut in nouitate uite ambulem in C. I. d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1423; ed. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 1–25; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6185.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on the Song of Songs
msItem.rubric: In exordium cantici canticorum usque ad eum locum in quo ait Quo adusque rex ueniat in recubitu suo
msItem.incipit: Quomodo dicimus per Moysen esse quedam non solum sancta sed et sancta sanctorum
msItem.explicit: ut digni efficiamur sponsi sermone sapiencia Christi Iesu cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1432; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 26–60; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6199; Lambert 206.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Isaiah
msItem.incipit: Quam diu Ozias rex uixit uidere non potuit uisionem Ysaias propheta
msItem.explicit: et efficeris filius Dei in Christo Iesu cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1437; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 242–89; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6202; Lambert 209.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Jeremiah
msItem.incipit: Quo tempore Ieremias exorsus est prophetare
msItem.explicit: magnificare omnipotentem Deum cum Christo Iesu cui ...

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Ezechiel
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Eusebii Ieronimi in omelias Origenis super Ezechiel numero quatuordecim
msItem.incipit: Magnum est quidem amice quod postulas
Non omnis qui captiuus est propter peccata sustinet captiuitatem
msItem.note: CPG 1440; SChr 352 (1989); Stegmüller, Bibl. 6208; Lambert 214. fol. 172v is blank but for a few faint later notes; 173rv blank.
II is annotated in a distinctive anglicana hand of university type, s. xiv in., as well as others including Reynham’s. At the foot of fol. 118 ‘Lectio bona sed obscura’.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 235 155 , ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 36 lines; written above the top line.

handDesc.handNote: A practised English early gothic bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 14 a nearly full-page P in colours and gold with red and blue pen-work spray filling the lower margin, in Channel Style, very like the decoration in All Souls Coll., MS 55 (Watson, All Souls, pl. 3(a); Alexander & Temple, no. 889 and pl. lxii); handsome large gold initials on square coloured grounds, fols. 24, 36v, 40, 52v, 56, 65v, 77, 81v, 89, 99, 107v, 113, 119, 130v, 137, 146v, 155v, 163, 166; red or blue initials flourished in the other colour.
